entry.title: Ranjit Vilas Palace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Wankaner's Ranjit Vilas Palace (pictured) in Gujarat, India, features Venetian Gothic, Italianate, Mughal and Rajput styles?

entry.title: Tova Friedman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tova Friedman is a Holocaust survivor who now posts videos of her life and survival on TikTok?

entry.title: ampullae of Lorenzini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the ampullae of Lorenzini enable sharks to sense electric fields?

entry.title: Gilbert Bundy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gilbert Bundy killed himself on the 12th anniversary of a traumatic experience as a war artist at the Battle of Tarawa?

entry.title: Hours of Charles the Noble (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the margins of the Hours of Charles the Noble contain 180 depictions of musical instruments, providing a representative overview of medieval instruments?

entry.title: Cleo Damianakes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cleo Damianakes's 1920s book dust jacket designs "made sex respectable", but Hemingway did not like the "large misplaced breasts" on A Farewell to Arms?

entry.title: The Summer Hikaru Died (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Summer Hikaru Died went from drawings on a Twitter account to receiving three times more print orders than copies available?

entry.title: Howie Shanks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a doctor told Howie Shanks that he only had a few weeks to live, but he lived another 31 years?
